devdoc.details: Contract for assets transfers. The user can transfer the asset to any of the approved chains. The admin manages the assets, fees and other important protocol parameters.

autoUpdateFixedNativeFee(uint256).details: Update native fix fee. Called by our fee update contract

blockSubmission(bytes32[],bool).details: Block or unblock a list of submissions

params.isBlocked: True to block, false to unblock

claim(bytes32,uint256,uint256,address,ui.details: Is used for transfers [into the native chain](https://docs.debridge.finance/the-core-protocol/transfers#transfer-from-secondary-chain-to-native-chain) to unlock the designated amount of asset from collateral and transfer it to the receiver.

params._amount: Amount of the transferred asset (note: the fee can be applied).

deployNewAsset(bytes,uint256,string,stri.details: Deploy a deToken(DeBridgeTokenProxy) for an asset

params._nativeTokenAddress: A token address on a native chain

getDebridgeChainAssetFixedFee(bytes32,ui.details: Returns asset fixed fee value for specified debridge and chainId.

params._tokenAddress: Address of the asset on the other chain.

params._debridgeId: Id of an asset, see getDebridgeId.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getSubmissionIdFrom(bytes32,uint256,uint.details: Calculate submission id for auto claimable transfer.

params._amount: Amount of the transferred asset (note: the fee can be applied).
params._chainIdFrom: Chain identifier of the chain where tokens are sent from.
params._hasAutoParams: True if auto params are provided

params._tokenAddress: Address of the asset on the other chain.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

initialize(uint8,address).details: Constructor that initializes the most important configurations.

params._excessConfirmations: minimal required confirmations in case of too many confirmations

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

send(address,uint256,uint256,bytes,bytes.details: This method is used for the transfer of assets [from the native chain](https://docs.debridge.finance/the-core-protocol/transfers#transfer-from-native-chain). It locks an asset in the smart contract in the native chain and enables minting of deAsset on the secondary chain.

params._amount: Amount to be transferred (note: the fee can be applied).
params._autoParams: Auto params for external call in target network
params._chainIdTo: Chain id of the target chain.
params._permitEnvelope: Permit for approving the spender by signature. bytes (amount + deadline + signature)
params._useAssetFee: use assets fee for pay protocol fix (work only for specials token)

sendMessage(uint256,bytes,bytes).details: Submits the message to the deBridge infrastructure to be broadcasted to another supported blockchain (identified by _dstChainId)      with the instructions to call the _targetContractAddress contract using the given _targetContractCalldata

params._targetContractAddress: A contract address to be called on the destination chain
params._targetContractCalldata: Calldata to execute against the target contract on the destination chain

sendMessage(uint256,bytes,bytes,uint256,.details: Submits the message to the deBridge infrastructure to be broadcasted to another supported blockchain (identified by _dstChainId)      with the instructions to call the _targetContractAddress contract using the given _targetContractCalldata

params._flags: A bitmask of toggles listed in the Flags library
params._referralCode: Referral code to identify this submission
params._targetContractAddress: A contract address to be called on the destination chain
params._targetContractCalldata: Calldata to execute against the target contract on the destination chain

setCallProxy(address).details: Set address of the call proxy.

params._callProxy: Address of the proxy that executes external calls.

setChainSupport(uint256,bool,bool).details: Set support for the chains where the token can be transferred.

params._chainId: Chain id where tokens are sent.
params._isSupported: Whether the token is transferable to the other chain.

setFeeContractUpdater(address).details: Set fee contract updater, that can update fix native fee

setWethGate(address).details: Set wethGate contract, that uses for weth withdraws affected by EIP1884

params._amountThreshold: Threshold amount after which Math.max(excessConfirmations,SignatureVerifier.minConfirmations) is used instead of SignatureVerifier.minConfirmations
params._maxAmount: Maximum amount of current chain token to be wrapped.

updateExcessConfirmations(uint8).details: Update minimal amount of required signatures, must be > SignatureVerifier.minConfirmations to have an effect

updateGlobalFee(uint256,uint16).details: Update fallbacks for fixed fee in native asset and transfer fee

params._globalFixedNativeFee: Fallback fixed fee in native asset, used if a chain fixed fee is set to 0
params._globalTransferFeeBps: Fallback transfer fee in BPS, used if a chain transfer fee is set to 0

BPS_DENOMINATOR.details: Basis points or bps, set to 10 000 (equal to 1/10000). Used to express relative values (fees)

callProxy.details: Returns address of the proxy to execute user's calls.

excessConfirmations.details: Minimal required confirmations in case sent amount is big, have no effect if less than SignatureVerifier.minConfirmations

feeContractUpdater.details: Contract address that can override globalFixedNativeFee

feeProxy.details: Returns proxy to convert the collected fees and transfer to Ethereum network to treasury

getAmountThreshold.details: Maps debridgeId (see getDebridgeId) to threshold amount after which Math.max(excessConfirmations,SignatureVerifier.minConfirmations) is used instead of SignatureVerifier.minConfirmations

getChainFromConfig.details: Whether the chain for the asset is supported to claim

getChainToConfig.details: Whether the chain for the asset is supported to send

getNativeInfo.details: Returns native token info by wrapped token address

globalFixedNativeFee.details: Fallback fixed fee in native asset, used if a chain fixed fee is set to 0

globalTransferFeeBps.details: Fallback transfer fee in BPS, used if a chain transfer fee is set to 0

isBlockedSubmission.details: Returns whether the transfer with the submissionId is blocked.

isSubmissionUsed.details: Returns whether the transfer with the submissionId was claimed. submissionId is generated in getSubmissionIdFrom

signatureVerifier.details: Current signature verifier address to verify signatures.

weth.details: Returns contract for wrapped native token.

wethGate.details: WethGate contract, that is used for weth withdraws affected by EIP1884

sendMessage(uint256,bytes,bytes).notice: NO ASSETS ARE BROADCASTED ALONG WITH THIS MESSAGEDeBridgeGate only accepts submissions with msg.value (native ether) covering a small protocol fee         (defined in the globalFixedNativeFee property). Any excess amount of ether passed to this function is         included in the message as the execution fee - the amount deBridgeGate would give as an incentive to         a third party in return for successful claim transaction execution on the destination chain.DeBridgeGate accepts a set of flags that control the behaviour of the execution. This simple method         sets the default set of flags: REVERT_IF_EXTERNAL_FAIL, PROXY_WITH_SENDER

sendMessage(uint256,bytes,bytes,uint256,.notice: NO ASSETS ARE BROADCASTED ALONG WITH THIS MESSAGEDeBridgeGate only accepts submissions with msg.value (native ether) covering a small protocol fee         (defined in the globalFixedNativeFee property). Any excess amount of ether passed to this function is         included in the message as the execution fee - the amount deBridgeGate would give as an incentive to         a third party in return for successful claim transaction execution on the destination chain.DeBridgeGate accepts a set of flags that control the behaviour of the execution. This simple method         sets the default set of flags: REVERT_IF_EXTERNAL_FAIL, PROXY_WITH_SENDER
